symbols.name: sap.tnt
symbols.description: SAPUI5 library with controls specialized for administrative applications.
symbols.title: namespace sap.tnt

nodes.name: sap.tnt.InfoLabel
nodes.description: The InfoLabel is a small non-interactive control which contains text information and non-semantic color chosen from a list of predefined color schemes.

nodes.name: sap.tnt.NavigationList
nodes.description: The NavigationList control is an interactive control, which provides a choice of different items, ordered as a list.

nodes.name: sap.tnt.NavigationListItem
nodes.description: The NavigationListItem control represents an action, which can be selected by the user.

nodes.name: sap.tnt.SideNavigation
nodes.description: The SideNavigation control is a container, which consists of flexible and fixed parts on top of each other.

nodes.name: sap.tnt.ToolHeader
nodes.description: The ToolHeader control is a horizontal container that is most commonly used to display buttons, labels, and other various input controls.

nodes.name: sap.tnt.ToolHeaderUtilitySeparator
nodes.description: The ToolHeaderUtilitySeparator control is used in the sap.tnt.ToolHeader control to specify where the overflow button is placed.

nodes.name: sap.tnt.ToolPage
nodes.description: The ToolPage is a layout control, used to create a basic tools app that has a header, side navigation and contents area.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.InfoLabel
symbols.description:
The InfoLabel is a small non-interactive control which contains text information and non-semantic color chosen from a list of predefined color schemes. It serves the purpose to attract the user attention to some piece of information (state, quantity, condition, etc.).

Overview

The control visualizes text information without user interaction. The text inside the control is always in upper case. It can have smaller or larger side paddings which can be specified by the renderMode property. The text-background color pair can be changed by setting a digit between 1 and 9 that corresponds to the 9 predefined color combinations of the colorScheme property. The control is designed to be vertically aligned with UI5 Input and Button control families. When using InfoLabel in non-editable Forms, Tables, etc., set displayOnly=true for best visual results.

Limitations

  • If the text is longer than the width of the control, it doesn’t wrap. Instead, it’s represented as ellipsis.
  • When truncated, the full text in the control is not visible. Therefore, it’s recommended to make more space for longer items to be fully displayed.
  • Colors are not semantic and have no visual representation in sap_belize_hcb and sap_belize_hcw themes.
  • The control shows plain text only, formatting is not visualized.

properties.name: colorScheme
properties.description: Specifies the fill and text color of the control. Accepts a digit as a value. You can choose from 9 predefined background and text color combinations. The color schemes are non-semantic, you can select them according to your own preferences. The default colorScheme is 7.

properties.name: displayOnly
properties.description: Determines if the InfoLabel is in displayOnly mode. When set to true the control size adjusts to fit other controls, for example non-editable Forms.

properties.name: renderMode
properties.description: Specifies the type of the InfoLabel paddings - loose or narrow. Note: By default the padding is loose. It is recommended to use narrow (smaller) paddings for numeric texts.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Available options for the text direction are LTR and RTL. By default the control inherits the text direction from its parent control.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Specifies the width of the InfoLabel control. By default, the InfoLabel control has the width of the content. Set this property to restrict the width to a custom value.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new InfoLabel.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: bindText

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oBindingInfo
parameters.description: The binding information

methods.description:
Binds property text to model data.

See ManagedObject.bindProperty for a detailed description of the possible properties of oBindingInfo

methods.name: sap.tnt.InfoLabel.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.tnt.InfoLabel with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Control.extend.

methods.name: getColorScheme

returnValue.description: Value of property colorScheme

methods.description:
Gets current value of property colorScheme.

Specifies the fill and text color of the control. Accepts a digit as a value. You can choose from 9 predefined background and text color combinations. The color schemes are non-semantic, you can select them according to your own preferences. The default colorScheme is 7.

Default value is 7.

methods.name: getDisplayOnly

returnValue.description: Value of property displayOnly

methods.description:
Gets current value of property displayOnly.

Determines if the InfoLabel is in displayOnly mode. When set to true the control size adjusts to fit other controls, for example non-editable Forms.

Default value is false.

Specifies the type of the InfoLabel paddings - loose or narrow. Note: By default the padding is loose. It is recommended to use narrow (smaller) paddings for numeric texts.

Default value is Loose.

returnValue.description: Value of property text

methods.description:
Gets current value of property text.

Specifies the text inside the InfoLabel control.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getTextDirection

returnValue.description: Value of property textDirection

methods.description:
Gets current value of property textDirection.

Available options for the text direction are LTR and RTL. By default the control inherits the text direction from its parent control.

Default value is Inherit.

returnValue.description: Value of property width

methods.description:
Gets current value of property width.

Specifies the width of the InfoLabel control. By default, the InfoLabel control has the width of the content. Set this property to restrict the width to a custom value.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.NavigationList
symbols.description: The NavigationList control is an interactive control, which provides a choice of different items, ordered as a list.

properties.name: expanded
properties.description: Specifies if the control is in expanded or collapsed mode.

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs, which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs, which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new NavigationList.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The selected item.

methods.name: addAriaDescribedBy

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: vAriaDescribedBy
parameters.description: The ariaDescribedBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some ariaDescribedBy into the association ariaDescribedBy.

methods.name: addAriaLabelledBy

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: vAriaLabelledBy
parameters.description: The ariaLabelledBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some ariaLabelledBy into the association ariaLabelledBy.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oItem
parameters.description: The item to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.name: attachItemSelect

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.tnt.NavigationList itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the itemSelect event of this sap.tnt.NavigationList.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.tnt.NavigationList itself.

Fired when an item is selected.

methods.name: destroyItems

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Destroys all the items in the aggregation items.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.SideNavigation
symbols.description:
The SideNavigation control is a container, which consists of flexible and fixed parts on top of each other.

Responsive Behavior

  • The flexible part adapts its size to the fixed one.
  • The flexible part has a scrollbar when the content is larger than the available space.
Note: In order for the SideNavigation to stretch properly, its parent layout control should only be the sap.tnt.ToolPage.

aggregations.name: item
aggregations.description: Defines the content inside the flexible part.

aggregations.name: fixedItem
aggregations.description: Defines the content inside the fixed part.

aggregations.name: _topArrowControl
aggregations.description: The top arrow, used for scrolling throw items when SideNavigation is collapsed.

aggregations.name: _bottomArrowControl
aggregations.description: The bottom arrow, used for scrolling throw items when SideNavigation is collapsed.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.ToolHeader
symbols.description:
The ToolHeader control is a horizontal container that is most commonly used to display buttons, labels, and other various input controls.

Overview

The ToolHeader control is based on sap.m.OverflowToolbar. It contains clearly structured menus of commands that are available across the various apps within the same tool layout.

Usage

  • If an app implements side navigation in addition to the tool header menu, the menu icon must be the first item on the left-hand side of the tool header.
  • The app menu and the side navigation must not have any dependencies and must work independently.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata

Creates a new subclass of class sap.tnt.ToolHeader with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.m.OverflowToolbar.extend.

symbols.description: The ToolHeaderUtilitySeparator control is used in the sap.tnt.ToolHeader control to specify where the overflow button is placed.

parameters.name: mSettings

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new ToolHeaderUtilitySeparator.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type sap.ui.core.Control can be used.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.ToolPage
symbols.description:
The ToolPage is a layout control, used to create a basic tools app that has a header, side navigation and contents area.

Overview

The control has three main areas - a header on top, navigation to the side and a content are that can hold any control. The header and side navigation use custom controls - sap.tnt.ToolHeader and sap.tnt.SideNavigation.

Usage

The main usage for the asp.tnt controls is for scenarios in the tooling or administration space.

properties.description: Indicates if the side area is expanded. Overrides the expanded property of the sideContent aggregation.
